com.googlecode.imheresi1.database
Interface PersistenceManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
XmlPersistence
public interface PersistenceManager

Interface that dictates methods that a Persistence Manager object needs to implement Persistence Manager is an object used only to save the data that the ImHere process uses.

Author:
Arthur de Souza Ribeiro, Jose Laerte, Raquel Rolim, Raissa Sarmento

Method Detail

hasUser

boolean hasUser(java.lang.String user)
Method to check if a user by the given userName exists in the System

Parameters:
user - string representing the userName to check if the user exists
Returns:
true if the System contains a user by that userName

getUserByName

User getUserByName(java.lang.String name,
                   int occurrence)
Method that gets a User Object found by the given name and occurrence. The occurrence value determines which user to return in case of multiple users in which the names match the parameter name

Parameters:
name - string representing the searched user's name
occurrence - number to determine the user to return
Returns:
user object representing the user found.
See Also:
User

getUserByUserName

User getUserByUserName(java.lang.String userName)
Method that gets a User Object found by the given userName

Parameters:
name - string representing the searched user's userName
Returns:
object representing the user found.
See Also:
User

clearInvitations

void clearInvitations()
Method that deletes all invitations sent through the System

getInvitations

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getInvitations()
Method that returns an object representing all the invitations sent.

Returns:
map that links a string (representing the userName of the user who sent the invitation) to a list of strings (representing all the usernames to which an invitation was sent).

saveInvitations

void saveInvitations(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> invitations)
Method to save a new invitation in the invitation file

Parameters:
invitations - invitations map that represents the new invitations the given map links a string (representing the userName of the user who sent the invitation) to a list of strings (representing all the usernames to which an invitation was sent).

saveUser

void saveUser(User user,
              java.lang.String userName)
Saves the user in the database. If the userName already exists: overrides the file. Otherwise it creates a new file.

Parameters:
user - User Object that contains the data to be saved.
userName - User's userName. Which dictates the file name.
See Also:
User

removeUser

void removeUser(java.lang.String userName)
                throws PersistenceManagerException
Deletes the file that refers to the specified user.

Parameters:
userName - user to be removed form the System.
Throws:
PersistenceManagerException - In case the user doesn't exists.
